result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarmell Bingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 105 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the co-actor:  Jeremaya Gross
Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges for school and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarmell Bingham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarmell Bingham in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jarmell Bingham in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 105 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

*As a condition of probation, The Court ordered the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction,  Huber privileges for school and treatment.  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the co-actor:  Jeremaya Gross
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.


Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letter received from defendant, filed.

Defendant Jarmell Bingham in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jarmell Bingham in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Parties are going to proceed with a projected guilty plea today.  

  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.      Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarmell Bingham not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Demand For Discovery And Inspection
Defense counsel requests scheduling conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Defendant previously posted $500.00.  Balance due is $2,000.00.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarmell Bingham not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel newly appointed, does not have information for the Court as to how the defendant was taken into custody.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on October 30, 2015
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned on November 6, 2015
for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 26.
Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court prior to case being called.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered no bail be forfeited at this time.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jarmell Bingham not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Jarmell Bingham in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/30/15.

Defendant Jarmell Bingham in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke. Joy Hammond for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/18/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jarmell Bingham in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jarmell Bingham in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
